dialogues.text: We're not talking about buying a car Jake. We're talking about killing your wife. It's thirteen, or it's nothing. For a moment the two men stand silent.  All we hear is th ticking of a grandfather CLOCK that stands in the corner. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drive a hard bargain, but I had a feeling you were my boy when I met you. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not your boy.  I don't like you.  I got no choice but to do business with you. Let's just call this a nasty little marriage of convenience. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that.  I had a marriage of convenience with Grace, and look where that's lead...  Well, looks like we got ourselves a contract. BOBBY (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we shake hands? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can't trust the man you've hired to kill your wife ...? The thing is it's got to look like an accident; that's the thing. If it doesn't, then it's no good.  I won't get a dime, and it's my neck that'll be on the chopping block while you're living it up somewhere. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you want it? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell should I know?  I've never had a wife killed before. Jesus Christ! You want this job, you don't know how to do this? I guess I should have hired a professional. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to do this yourself?  I don't have to do this, you know. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet, boy.  I got to figure this thing. I'm thinking. It can't be done at the house. It should be... Jake walks the office thinking. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to think of it, how 'bout some money upfront? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah sure. Why don't I buy you a plane ticket right out of here while I'm at it. I know you... (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you do:  Go to the house to see her. BOBBY (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tell her what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY stands on the porch talking to GRACE through the sc the front door.  The look on his face is sincere.  Hers i skeptical.  We see the action take place as we hear Jake' JAKE(V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't know.  Tell her you had to see her.  Tell her you don't care if she's married or not, you had to be with her. Sweet talk the woman.  A young buck like you must be good at that.  Then ... maybe shift the conversation.  Get her thinking about that jeep of hers.  She loves that thing.  Maybe the only thing she does love. She'll want to take you for a ride. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're not surprised I'm back here, cause you can read my mind and all. She's not surprised. GRACE (seeing his new cut)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's some cut. I told you to be more careful. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I said I was an idiot. Whatta you say we get out of here, take a drive somewhere, talk... GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know he's still not here? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys like me take those chances. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE'S JEEP cuts hard across the desert.  Grace has a wi excited look on her face.  BOBBY sits next to her looking somewhat nervous. JAKE(V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll take you out somewhere in the desert.  She loves it out there; ridin' through the red rock and the mesas.  So do I.  I guess we got that in common.  She'll ride you out someplace quiet.  Someplace deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE has stopped the JEEP on a plateau.  BOBBY sits bene shade while Grace walks in the sun seemingly unaffected b heat. VULTURES swoop above. JAKE(V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be anyone for miles around. Just the two of you and some prairie dogs. That's all.  You can sweet talk her a little if you like.  Makes no difference to me.  Just put her at ease, make her feel relaxed -- then do it. JAKE'S V.O. ends.  The scene is now synch with real time. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are there snakes out here? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear you comin'.  They won't bother you. Just don't sneak up on 'em. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't the isolation bother you? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I like the sun.  I grew up on a reservation.  The sun, the desert; they like a religion to us.  Jake's the same way.  He loves the desert.  I guess we're alike that way.  That's about the only way. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love him? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on what you call love. I grew up on a reservation. A patch of desert in the middle of nowhere. That's where they stick Indians, Bobby. That's where they leave us to die. My brother killed himself when he was 19 cause he couldn't take it anymore. There's no hope there... Jake was my ticket out. Mom and me. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you're with him? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I let him think he was courtin' me, but I reeled him in like a fish on a line. I wanted him. I wanted what he could give me, and I would've done anything to get him. Is that love? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm guessing no. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess you're right. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it things didn't much work out the way you planned. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still here, aren't I?  See this? Grace sweeps her hand before her across the expanse of th desert. The vultures are very much a part of this landsca GRACE(CONT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this nothing? It doesn't get to Jake like it gets to me.  He says he don't mind being nothing but a big fish in a small pond.  More like a little fish in a dried up watering hole. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could leave him. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk away. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that easy.  Maybe you can take chances; maybe you can wander around like some stray wherever you please.  I can't. I don't want to be alone.  I need to know I'm going to be taken care of. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a meal ticket is what you mean. Some guy you can latch onto just long enough for him to get you out of here. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so bad?  It's not like I wouldn't try to make him happy.  For awhile, anyway. I mean, I would ... do things for him.  I guess I'm no good that way.  I guess I tried to sucker you along like that.  Do you hate me for it?  I wouldn't blame you if you did.  But maybe it's like you said: You just got to do whatever it takes to get out. BOBBY (soft echo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes. Grace steps to the edge of the plateau. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was a bird.  I know it's stupid. Every child says that.  When I was growing up some of the old ones on the reservation believed people could actually change into animals.  I wish I could. We see Bobby behind Grace.  He stares at her standing on edge of the plateau.  He rises and walks towards her slow with deliberation. GRACE(CONT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was a bird I would fly to Florida; to Disney World.  I always wanted to go there. I'd fly to New York.  Maybe.  I guess New York isn't the best place to be a bird. I'd fly to St. Louis, then New Orleans, all over Texas.  Then I'd fly to California.  I guess by then I'd have seen it all and I could die. Bobby now stands a few feet behind Grace.  She kicks a ro watches it sail over the lip of the cliff into the nothin below. GRACE(CONT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say you don't feel anything.  The shock kills you before you hit the ground. I don't know how they would know that.  But I heard it's just like flying; straight down into the ground.  I guess if it doesn't hurt it's a beautiful thing. Bobby tenses himself.  Sweat forms on his brow as he stan directly behind Grace with his hands extended before him. hover just below her shoulder blades ready to push forwar Suddenly Grace wheels.  Startled by Bobby she almost fall the edge.  Bobby grabs her, her weight still going back. Grace's life is literally in his hands.  She looks down a ground far below, then up into Bobby's eyes.  She shows n but instead wears a curious smirk. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate's a funny thing.  Right now I bet you don't know if you want to kill me, or fuck me. Bobby hesitates, then pulls Grace close and kisses her wi great ardor on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a blanket on the ground, BOBBY and GRACE make love qui hotly, her dress pulled up, his pants down. But Grace is troubled and pulls out, further frustrating Bobby. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...Stop!  I can't! Her eyes withdraw into another dimension, as she hikes he back up. Bobby comes out of his own head, feels the dista between them. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?...Grace? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't feel like nothing. He finishes relieving himself behind a tree, puts his pan on. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of town, Bobby, as quick as you can. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, I've been fucked over too many times, by too many women.  You're becoming the queen of hot and cold. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd never understand. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just such a mess. With Jake I mean... BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing I understand better than a mess. GRACE (in great tension)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake was with my Mom after my real Dad died. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the Shaman? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a Shaman...in the mine. We had nothin' after he died. Jake took us in, gave us a little money. He used to call me his "little halfbreed"... He kept Mom on the side y'know, cause he was married someplace else. He had kids in Phoenix I think, no one knew him around here...but the thing was...you see... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he was raping me the whole time...for years. He loved to do things to me. Believe it or not, he used to say he was in love with my ass. Y'ever been in love with a woman's ass? The dominoes are tumbling for Bobby. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sick too...he loved to do things to me. Control me. My Mom...it tore her up cause she couldn't do nothing about it. She become alcoholic...and the funny thing is-- I liked it. I liked being controlled by Jake. The truth was as far out and crazy as he got, I wanted more. I wanted to go all the way. Women say they don't want to be taken like, really taken -- that's bullshit -- they do. The first time he finished with me, he said I was a woman now. I was 14. Then he started crying like a baby...wanted me to hold him. It's a strange feeling to hate someone so much for so many years, but still want to hold him, comfort him... They found my Mom right down there (points) at the bottom of Apache Leap. She had cactus needles stuck all over her body and Virgil...Sheriff Potter said she was drunk and went insane. But I'll never believe she ran off that cliff by accident. She was born on this earth and she loved it. She was like me. She just wanted to fly away. Bobby is quietly stunned. A whole world has opened up to and he isn't sure yet where the story ends. There is some at work here, beyond his control. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After he got his divorce, he forced me to marry him...but when I saw her body, I swore to her on my soul that some day I'd get Jake for what he did to her... BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What do you want. Life, right? (shrugs, stoic) Have you ever been to California? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. GRACE (as if in a dream)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it far from here? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. It's far, it's another world. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it pretty? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. It's beautiful, beautiful beaches. Blue water and clear skies as far as you can see. GRACE (like a little girl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you take me with you? BOBBY (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I won't hang on you. As soon as we get there you can dump me. I don't care. I just want to get out of here. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, baby, I can't. I can't even get out of here myself. Believe it or not, I need a lousy hundred and fifty bucks to get my car back from that crazy mechanic... GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darrell?  You know he and Jake are... BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have any money put away, do you? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake never gives me more'n twenty bucks at a time, like a bird in a cage, he don't want me goin' anywhere... BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you could get me money. I'll get you out of here. She looks at him. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's money. A lot. The words hang there, thick between them. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake hides it. In a safe. In the floor. In the bedroom. He counts it. He loves to sit there and count it. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At night. He just sits there and laughs and talks to himself and counts it. I heard him. My Mom told me he had a hunnert thousand dollars down there. Maybe more. Bobby's eyes widen in hope. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In cash? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. There's nothing else with Jake. He don't trust banks. He keeps the money in the floor right under the bed. He loves it so much, he wouldn't think of spending any of it on me. I never seen it but I know he's got more than a hunnert thousand at least... BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-hundred-thousand!?  That son-of-a-bitch. GRACE (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? BOBBY (ignoring her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's in a safe we'd have to get the combination-- GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a key.  He keeps it on himself all the time.  I mean all the time.  It scratches up against me when we do it. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the key's on him, how do we get the key? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him. Spoken almost innocently, it hangs there between them. A silence. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't kill, Grace. I can't kill anybody. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like he's a young man, Bobby. He's had time to live. It'd be quick. I mean, he wouldn't even have to feel it... (seductively) I mean, sometime in the middle of the night, when it's quiet...when he's asleep, you could just come up behind him when he's pounding on me and... Grace lays her hands on Bobby, starting to caress him. He bristles and freezes with fear and disgust. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Listen to you... Are you crazy, Grace? He abruptly pulls away. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! I think this place is making me crazy. I was crazy to come back here and see you. I'm crazy for listening to anyone in this town, and I'd sure as hell be crazy if I spent another minute with you. Grace rises, covering her nakedness, shooting a hand to h face, like she did when she read his fortune. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's in you, Bobby. I see it. I see Death. It's in your heart. Let it out for me. Let it out... He's mesmerized. Then: GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it for me, Bobby, you'll never regret it. I promise you. I'll do anything for you. Anything. Bobby pauses, terribly torn. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...take me back to town... He turns away, towards the jeep. Grace has a tone of desp in her voice. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need the money, Bobby. It's a lot more than $100,000. A lot more. How are you going to get out of here? You need the money. Whatever it takes, Bobby, remember? Bobby walks past the jeep, on his way back to town alone. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going? I'll give you the ride...Come back! Bobby? It's three miles. Bobby doesn't look back. Her eyes drift backwards into he solitude. GRACE (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby?...Whatever it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY walks through the desert parallel to the road, stil rage. Desert insects produce a cacophony of drones, buzze clicks. A rattlesnake darts off a rock into the brush. A whispers to him. JAKE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the killing in you, boy. Bobby turns and looks around. Just desert. He continues. JAKE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time you'll do just fine. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! The screen burns a bright white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a news pot, further down the street from where he was seen, the old, BLIND MAN sits with his dead DOG, speaking into camera, sipping on a Dr. Pepper. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the desert that makes you crazy. The loneliness out here. Nobody to talk to. People on the run. Trailer parks. White trash. I seen some peculiar things on a hot day.  I seen a scorpion sting itself to death.  It just keeps driving its tail into its body again and again.  A little killer killing itself.  Seen a coyote kill itself too.  Just kept on biting and tearing at its own legs.  Near tore one clean off before it bled to death.  And what a white man'll do when it's freezing one moment, hot as hell the next. A man could get hisself killed just for rubbing shoulders with another (smacking his lips) kiss kissy kiss. Nice pussy y'see, see it coming. I don't know what it is about the desert. I figger it's sort of like putting a kettle of water over a fire.  People is mostly water.  We boil when it's hot.  'Cept when we boil the water's got no place to go.  It just churns inside of us until we can cool off.  If it's not too late. BOBBY is now revealed standing next to the blind man, and realize the blind man has been talking to him all along. sips a Dr. Pepper as well. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure seen a lot for a blind man. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just 'cause I ain't got eyes doesn't mean I can't see. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That a fact? Bobby noticing now all the little NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS tha Blind Man keeps around him in a sort of inchoate stall. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see just fine.  For example:  You're a young man who thinks he's got someplace to be. A POLICE RADIO crackles, Bobby tensing. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I do. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe you just think you do. Just another small town. One guy chasing you. You go big town. Just gonna have four guys after you instead. Kiss kissy kiss. It gets down to one thing -- are you a human being or are you one of those hungry ghosts out there never satisfied with nothing? Cause you gotta remember you can run just as far as you can, but wherever you go, that's where you gonna be. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've heard that before. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want for free? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure got a lot of philosophy, old man. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like I do but only cause end of the day we're all eyes in the same head. And everything is everything. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And everything is nothing too. BOBBY (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe one day I'll get to sit on a corner and spout wise. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you'll live that long? Bobby is clearly unnerved by this. Suddenly the blind man stands, pissed and powerful, sniffing the air with the po radio in it. As SHERIFF POTTER cruises by, glancing at Bobby shrinking car goes on up the street. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocksucker motherfucker! Cops. I hear you. Always sneaking around. Thinks I can't see him. Well he's right. Motherfucker. But that ain't mean I don't know what's going on around here. They're all cursed. Yes sir. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's cursed? BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All them miners last century. Hungry ghosts, killed off all the Indians. Up at the mine. Earth ran red with blood, think I'm fooling around here. White sky was on fire. Grown men cried like babies. I saw a flash, then darkness descended upon me. They put me in the joint. Took my eyes. I cursed them. White people can't seem to stay away from Indians (grabs his bandaged hand, smelling the blood). You gotta watch where ya put your fingers. Pussy pussy pussy, Indian pussy. It sounds demented. Bobby, checking him out to see if he' really blind, walks quietly around him during this monolo peeks over his glasses trying to see the blind man's real Although he thinks the Blind Man thinks he's on the other of him, the Blind Man fools him by suddenly swivelling ar and cranking a gob of spit into Bobby's face as if Bobby the other side. Bobby, pissed, wipes the spittle from his face. BLIND MAN (finishing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but they gotta know you don't fuck around with Indians. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said you lost your eyes in the war? BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you're going to tell me where I lost my eyes. You don't think I know where I lost my eyes? I was there when I lost them. I lost them in the war. The war in the joint. There's always wars in the joint. Cause I was a code talker in the joint and in the war too.(sniffs) Mmmm, nothing like the smell of a naked lady. Be careful, boy. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musta been some bad ass nuclear tests here in the 50's. This town's all inbreeding. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, people gotta get by somehow. That's the curse. The mines done it. All that uranium, plutonium, fuffonium, fuckononium, assononium, all that "om"! Everybody's got a mother. You don't rip up your mother. You don't rip up the Earth and take everything out. It's like the Cracker Jack box says, "the more you eat, the more you want...."... BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got things to do. BLIND MAN (offended)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well, go do 'em. You don't see me stopping you... Bobby starts to walk away. The Blind Man rattles his tin BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But ain't you got a little something for the infirm? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little short Pops. I'll catch you next time. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your lies are old, but you tell 'em well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY, depressed, is heading towards Harlin's gas station passing JENNY sitting on a corner drinking a soda, almost waiting for him. She runs to him, and follows him, as som a POLICE RADIO crackles and buzzes. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey mister. Mister, I just... I just wanted to thank you. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For defending my honor this afternoon. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to bust your bubble honey, but I wasn't defending you. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you was going to fight for me. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't going to fight for you.  I was just going to beat the shit out of your boyfriend. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not my boyfriend.  I mean, I let him take me out and stuff, but I ain't spoken for.  Not yet that is. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it through your head, little girl; I'm not going for you.  If this Toby likes you, then if I were you I'd marry him.  You're not going to get much better in this town. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought until you came riding in.  I saw your car over at the gas station.  It's a cool car.  Want to take me for a ride?  Desert's kind of lonely this time of day. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you? JENNY (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen... Well, I'm gonna be eighteen in two years, but that don't mean you can't take me for a ride if you want. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't want to take you for a ride. What I want is for ... Hey, you don't think you can get $150 from your parents, could you? From OFF CAMERA we hear TOBY. TOBY(O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister! BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! Toby moves menacingly up the street towards Bobby. TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Mister.  You better be afraid.  I told you it wasn't over, but you didn't listen.  Now I find you sneakin' around with my girl behind my back. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't sneaking around with your girl. Would you please tell him? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too late, Toby.  We're going to get in his fancy car and ride off and leave you behind. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name anyway? TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that tears it, Mister.  I'm gonna bust you up but good.  I'm gonna bust you into a million pieces and then ... and then bust those pieces up, and then ... and then spread them all around.  That's what I'm gonna do.  You don't know what you're dealing with, Mister.  I'm crazy.  I'm psycho crazy. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.  You're TNT.  Just like dynamite.  When you go off somebody gets hurt. (at his wit's end) All right.  Let's do this. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby Tucker, it don't matter to me if you beat him all up and knock out all his teeth and he's just drooling and bleeding all over hisself, 'cause we love each other and we gonna run off, and I'm gonna have his love child. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you shut up! TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna pay for that, Mister. Toby and Bobby square off, sizing each other up and prepa for a violent confrontation.  Just as the two are about t we hear the voice of SHERIFF POTTER from OFF CAMERA. SHERIFF(O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby! The two men freeze in their tracks, as Potter drives up f TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sheriff Potter. SHERIFF (tough)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby, I just came from your mother's place. She's worried sick about you.  She says she ain't seen you since this morning. TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't true, Sheriff.  I was home for lunch. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I'm not trying to hear nothing from you except that you're heading home.  Now run along. TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  Come on, Jenny. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to stay. TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said come on! Toby grabs Jenny by the wrist and literally pulls he alon she goes she yells back to Bobby. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Mister.  Don't go nowhere without me. I wanna have your love child. Toby points a vicious finger at Bobby. TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, Mister.  Next time. Toby and Jenny exit leaving Bobby and the Sheriff alone. would also like to exit fast. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where ya goin'? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlin's. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in. Bobby has no choice. He gets in. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen you popping up a little bit of everywhere today.  You're not planning on staying are you? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. I'm not going to be around long if that's what you're worried about. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nasty cut you got there. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, fell down and hit a rock. Not as bad as it looks. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a young fellow over at Jamilla's today when it got hit.  Way she tells it he got whacked around good by one of the robbers. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like it. I wish I could help Sheriff, but I just want to get my car and get on up the road. JAKE drives up in his GOLD CADDY. His windows whirr down. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything all right, Virgil? He eyes Bobby. SHERIFF (a little nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fine, Jake. Where you going? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just up at Darrell's. How's the wife? That little eskimo baby walkin' yet? SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh just fine. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't seen Grace around, have you? I'm looking for her. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But if I do, I'll tell her you're looking for her, Jake. JAKE (looking at Bobby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha got there, some trash? He drives off. The Sheriff drives on. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peculiar, how things happen. A man's car breaks down. There's a hold up. People die and all that money -- and now old Jake out looking for his young wife. And then you show up... The Sheriff looks right through Bobby, who knows this is than a conversation. He pulls up to Harlin's garage. Bobb out. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's running out, son. I'll be seeing you in the morning... With this thinly veiled threat, the Sheriff drives on. As watches, feeling the pressure to get out now while he can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARRELL is cleaning his tools.  Bobby's MUSTANG sits prom in the car bay, washed and gleaming, as BOBBY walks up. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there.  I was beginnin' to think you wasn't comin' back...  You don't look so good. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I've been around the bend a bit. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those days you feel like you been runnin' in circles and you ain't no closer to where you tryin' to get than when you started? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been there? DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I've had days I would gladly trade with a whippin' dog.  Ain't much you can do when you feel like that 'cept tough it out. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe that? DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think bad, and bad is what you get. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good piece of advice, Darrell. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No charge. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Darrell, about that hundred-fifty bucks for the car, as soon as I get where I'm going I swear I'll-- DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-hundred. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to cost you two-hundred dollars. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said this morning the hose was going to run me one-fifty. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.  For the hose.  But while you was gone I replaced a gasket.  That's going to run you another fifty. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell you to replace any gasket. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it was shot. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a fuck! I didn't tell you to do it!  You can't just do unauthorized work. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now, you just know all there is about bein' a mechanic, don't you?  Didn't you read the sign. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sign? DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goddamn sign on the wall. I can't do unauthorized work?  What am I suppose to do? Just let you ride out of here with a bad gasket.  Then you get in an accident and get killed.  Or worse.  Who they gonna blame then?  They gonna blame me, and there goes my reputation. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What reputation?  You're nothing but an ignorant, inbred, tumbleweed hick. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that an insult?  Are you insulting me. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen you stupid fuck, I want my car. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me you sorry sonufabitch. You owe me money, and this car ain't going nowheres until I get it.  And if you take another five hours I'll find another fifty dollars worth of work to do on it. Is that clear? Now get out of here 'fore I call the Sheriff, who knows me. Bobby is in a rage.  He turns to leave and walks a few pa He sees a WRENCH lying on a table.  For a second his mind then he snatches up the wrench and turns ready to smash i on Darrell's head.  He stops cold.  Because ol' Darrell h CROWBAR in a batter's stance ready to smash it onto the M DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to play, Mister?  I'll play with you.  You want to smash something?  So do I. Darrell pulls back the crowbar, ready to swing. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Okay! Okay! DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?  The fight gone out of you?  I'm just gonna smash a headlight. Maybe two. BOBBY (pleading, almost crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, just leave the car alone! DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, you already pissed me off but good. Darrell lays the tip of the crowbar on the hood of the ca drags the tip of the bar across the hood leaving a long s BOBBY (about to lose it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn you!  You son of a bitch! DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, sweet talking me again. Darrell begins to laugh. Bobby, desperate, looks to the t thinking of his gun in there. His POV -- the trunk. A FLASHBACK of the GUN goes through mind. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Harlin. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darrell. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darrell. I'll get you your money. I just have to get something out of the trunk. Using his TRUNK KEY, he tries to open it but realizes the has been changed. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you do to my trunk? DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that key's not gonna work. I had to pop the lock. You didn't leave me the trunk key. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you had to go into the trunk, didn't you? DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I work on a car, I work on a car. BOBBY (snaps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You motherfucker! (etc.) DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't help yourself, can you mister? You're out of control. Darrell starts to laugh. It is a repetitive, almost demon laugh that grows louder as the camera slowly dollies in o Bobby's anguished face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As BOBBY steps out into the glaring sun, he notices down other end of the town, GRACE'S JEEP parked right outside SHERIFF'S OFFICE, empty. Presently, GRACE and the SHERIFF walk out TALKING, and sh in, says a few last words and drives away. Bobby backs around a corner into a sidestreet. Is she sel him out? He's very confused, turbulent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY enters the BUS DEPOT.  The interior is poorly lit. are a few benches for people to wait on, but they sit emp Old, faded travel posters hang on the wall.  A bored FEMA CLERK is behind the counter. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a ticket. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of here. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, in particular? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... Mexico.  You got a bus that goes to Mexico?  That's where I have to go. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mexico is a large country. Where in Mexico would you like-- BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care, just get me there. The clerk is a little put off by Bobby. He seems deliriou goes through her schedule looking for a bus. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Ciudad Juarez? You could take a local, arrives in two hours, and transfer in Albuquerque. It'll get you across the border. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much? CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One way, or round trip? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One way. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30.55. Twenty more will get you back. Bobby counts his money. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-seven, fifty.  That's all I got. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ticket is 30.55. BOBBY (rifling his pockets)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought a beer.  That was a dollar something. Then I gave that girl 25 cents for the juke box. And the blind man...the soda...I..I'd have 30 if...if... CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir.  It's $30.55 for the ticket. BOBBY (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Just a little short.  Figures.  I just wanted to get out, that's all. Bobby starts to walk away. Suddenly he turns, runs back a clerk, proffers his money, half-crazed, near tears. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, ma'am, you don't understand! I have to get out of here.  They're going to come looking for me.  They're going to kill me. If I can't get this ticket then I'm going to have to do things to get out of here. You know what I mean! I don't want to hurt anybody, I just want to leave. Please. I can't...I can't. He's so desperate and in her frightened but neutral expre Bobby experiences the only compassion he ever finds in th whole town. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll give you the ticket, sir, but...just...just, please calm down, please! her sane tone reminds Bobby of how far down he's come. He shrinks, suddenly ashamed of himself. She takes the cash counter, hands him a ticket. CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your change.  Bus three-twenty-three. Leaves at seven fifty two, tonight. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  It's just ... you know ... She nods, puts a "closed" sign in the ticket window, disa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the crackle of the same POLICE RADIO again, OFF C as BOBBY walks out of the depot. ticket preciously held i hand, and suddenly reels as he sees SERGEI, about a 100 y down the main stretch, slowly rolling into town in his convertible, looking for guess who. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY turns away, but not fast enough. SERGEI spots him, the pedal. SERGEI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you, shitface! Bobby Cooper. Bobby Cooper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY, ducking around a corner, hears the brief "Whoop" o sheriff's POLICE SIREN. He glances back. His POV - sure enough, the SHERIFF'S having a field day. just pulled SERGEI over. At this distance, we catch snipp conversation as the Sheriff ambles from his car, checking Sergei's out-of-state plates. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the fire sweetheart? Don't know how they work things in Nevada, but we got speed limits in this state. SERGEI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vat? I am going 5 miles an hour! I am looking town. I not even moving. We pop in closer to their conversation -- Bobby relishing in his mind's eye. Sergei is constantly looking off to wh last saw Bobby. But the Sheriff, strangely, pays no atten these looks. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, what kind of accent you got there? You one of them Russians? SERGEI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Russian, da! I am also rich Russian, da? Maybe we work something out, my friend Sheriff? SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You trying to bribe me, mister? Just cause you Russians ain't commies anymore, don't think money can buy everything... Down the street, Sheriff Potter is holding up a concealed SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? (He grabs the gun) ..."concealed" is a definite no no in this town, Ivan. You know anything about Jamilla's grocery store? SERGEI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What fuckin grocery store, you fucking shithead idiot! You call yourself a police... Sergei looking Bobby's direction. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the car, spread them. You can jawbone all you want or you have the right to shut the fuck up! You commie motherfucker. Either way you're goin' to the can. SERGEI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my lawyer! Sheriff cuffs Sergei and sticks him in the police car. Bobby can't help smiling as he turns away to the SODA MAC seen in an earlier scene. He comes up with the change the bus clerk left him and, d for a drink in this heat, inserts the coin. Though still considerable pressure from all sides, this lucky break wi Sergei seems like it might be the beginning of something today -- some luck. The icy cold soda bottle shoots out. Bobby raises it to h lips, about to taste it, about to relax for once. Violent explodes out of his hands as he doubles over in blinding from a KIDNEY PUNCH. He stumbles forward into the soda ma gasping. The legs of his assailant are close to him, but face is unseen. Bobby doubles his agony as his bandaged left stump takes brunt of the blow into the machine, re-opening the wound. starts to seep through the bandage. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Bobby crumples to the ground as TOBY now towers over him his fists curled and a snarl on his lips. TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up, Mister!  Don't ever let it be said Toby Tucker beat the living shit out of someone without giving them a fair chance. BOBBY (gasping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?  You fucking psycho! TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing what any man would do if he'd been offended.  I'm stompin' your ass. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You idiot!  You don't even know what you're fighting over! TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My honor, that's what I'm fighting over. Now get up off the ground, or do I have to whoop you where you lie? JENNY comes running up the street. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby!  Toby Tucker, leave him alone! TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay away, Jenny.  I aim to mess him up, and that ain't a thing for a woman to see. Jenny runs to Bobby and cuddles him where he lays. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid of him none.  I don't care what he does to you, we can still be together. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me! Bobby sees his bus ticket on the ground.  He grabs for it Toby beats him to it. TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, what's this? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me! TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mexico?  You going to Mexico? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving.  You never have to see me again.  Just please, give me the ticket! TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This means something to you?  Jenny means something to me. Toby sticks the ticket in his mouth and chews it up whole BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo! TOBY (between bites)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna beat you so bad you gonna be eatin' nothing but soup the erst of your days.  Rain dogs is gonna be prettier than you when I'm done.  I'm gonna mess you up so bad you gonna make your own momma sick. I'm gonna ... Toby's words drift to Bobby from a million miles away.  T world around him is like a dream, or a nightmare.  A prim wells inside of Bobby that rises up in a howl as he swing soda bottle up out of nowhere across Toby's head, smashin backwards. Then he lands blow after blow with his right h the boy's face and head. Jenny screams: JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  You're killing him! Jenny grabs Bobby's arm, literally hanging all her weight stopping him from striking Toby again. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're killing him!  Toby!?  Toby!? Jenny sinks to the ground and cuddles Toby.  Bobby stands looks at Toby, then at his bloodied knuckles in disbelief bandage is soaked with his own blood, but his adrenaline the pain. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him! You killed him! She wails in the background as he backs away, around the into Main Street, crossing to where the PHONE BOOTH is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY is on the phone. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Grace?  It's Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE, in the kitchen, is also on the phone. GRACE (coolly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be on your way to Vegas by now.  Is there something you wanted? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to talk. GRACE(V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we have anything to talk about. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about us? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no us, remember? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except I can't get you out of my head, Grace. (beat) GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. BOBBY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Am I making you hot, or does the truth scare you? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know you're full of shit. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it, Grace.  I'm getting out of here, and I want to take you with me. GRACE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you couldn't get your car. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could if I had Jake's money. GRACE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what changed your mind?  The money? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn about the money.  I want you, and I want to get us out of this shithole.  There's only one way to do that. Pause. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?...  About me, I mean? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came back for you; this morning I came back.  Before I even knew about the money. You're what I want. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only reason I stormed off is because you spooked me talking about Jake.  But I've had nothing but time to think about it.  It keeps coming back to you and me and us getting the hell out of here.  But we've got to get the money, baby.  We get the money, I get the car, then we get the hell out. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you couldn't kill anybody. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to kill him.  Just knock him out and tie him up 'till we get away. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was your idea, remember?  I'm doing this for you.  I'm doing this so you can fly...fly like a bird. Grace bites at a nail and fidgets, but says nothing. BOBBY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace ... Grace? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After dark.  I'll leave the back door unlocked. She quickly hangs up the phone. Bobby also hangs up the phone, an unreadable expression o face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE sits in an easy chair reading a paper.  Puffs of smo his pipe rise from behind the paper and hang like a cloud his head.  GRACE stands in the doorway, body stiff and ar crossed, staring at him. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that on the phone? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong number. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spent a long time talking for a wrong number.  But then you make friends so easily.  Don't you, Grace? Grace has no answer for that, so she says nothing.  A lon moment passes, then: GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put up new drapes, Jake. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I was here when your apprentice was helping you.  Remember? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never said anything.  About the drapes. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look nice. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't even looked at them once. Jake lowers the paper, looks at the drapes. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look nice. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I picked them out for you, Jake.  I thought you would like the colors. JAKE (softly, admiring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look just like your mama when you move like that against the light. Grace stares at the CHAIN now visible around Jake's neck disappears under his shirt.  She knows that hidden there key, and she fixes on it intently. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you looking at, girl? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, Jake.  Absolutely nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUN is setting. It strikes the horizon sending a ripp golden light through the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN dances in the evening light with a small child in h arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOG and CAT huddle together in sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF VIRGIL POTTER is tossing horseshoes with his DEPU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE watches the sun going down outside her house, cradl herself in her arms. A desert wind gently caresses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLIND MAN, along with his dead DOG, sits on the side street. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's it.  Sun's going down.  People go home, trade stories over dinner. They'll talk about the day, about the heat, laugh about something crazy it made them do.  They'll kiss, sleep a few hours, then do it all over again. BOBBY now appears next to the blind man holding two Dr. P He hands one to the blind man, takes a sip of the other o offers him his own change. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day wasn't so bad.  We all got through it all right. BLIND MAN (giving back the change)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it. There's a suggestion of cockiness in Bobby, feeling his l coming back with the night. His humour is enhanced by his down the street: As DARRELL, with his dilapidated truck, readies SERGEI'S convertible for towing. BLIND MAN (OVER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't over yet.  Night is part of day; separate, but equal.  Night is when you let your guard down; when you see things in the shadows and hear things in the dark. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Difference between you and me, old man, is I see the glass half full, you see it half empty. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night is when you want to sleep, but the dry heat keeps you tossin' and turnin'. It's when you wish the sun was bakin' high in the sky so you could see what it is you're afraid of. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You afraid of the dark? BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid of it?  Boy, I live in the dark. All cause of a woman who made me this way. People are afraid of what they can't see. I can't see nuthin', so it's all the same to me.  Kiss from a beautiful woman, kissy kissy kiss, a lick from a dog, slurp, slurp, the kiss of death (he makes a strange sound). It's all the same to me. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we're all just floating along like twigs in a stream, so enjoy the ride.  Is that it? BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More or less. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this twig, friend.  I got plans. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing makes the Great Spirit laugh harder than a man's plans. We all got plans. I planned on seeing all my life. I know you didn't plan on straying into town. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No and I don't plan on sticking around either. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't say I didn't warn you when things go your way. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a lotta philosophy in you, old timer but you don't fool me for one second with all this blind man crap. One minute you lost your eyes in Vietnam, next it's the joint. Now it's a woman? I'm hep to you. The Blind Man slowly lifts his glasses, showing his EYES last. Where his eyes should be are scars and dead flesh. sight that even takes Bobby back a step. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to be a young smartass like you. Then I got smart with the wrong man's daughter. Got some acid poured on my peepers for my trouble. You know human beings ain't always just human -- they got animals living inside 'em too...People give spare change to war heroes not fools. All fools get is pity. May not have eyes, but I see. And you, boy? The Blind Man puts his glasses back on. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got my pity. BOBBY (doesn't believe him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope she was worth it. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, she was worth it.  She was worth every black minute since. Bobby looks at his watch, gets ready to go, drops a coin the Blind Man's cup. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's up. Any last words of wisdom? BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things ain't always the way they seem. You got to ask yourself: is it worth it? Day comes Earthmaker is going to look in your fucking heart! Then you better know what it is you're doing. Are you a human being -- or just one of them hungry ghosts out there floatin' around? Bobby walks away, smiling. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are crazy, you know. Be seeing you, old man. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I won't be seeing you. The Blind Man lifts his sunglasses and peers into the cup he sees. We don't really know. He reaches into the cup an out the coin Bobby tossed in. BLIND MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheap bastard. Gives me back my own money... Well, Jesse, time's up, let's go for a walk. The Blind Man now stands up and pulls the seeing-eye dog' harness. The DOG struggles to its feet and they walk off the street together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE stands by the back door staring at the bolt lock. J yells to her from another room. JAKE(O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you doin', Grace?  Are you coming to bed, or aren't you? For a moment Grace's hand wavers above the lock.  Suddenl a snake striking, her hand shoots out and unlocks the bol Just as quickly she turns from the door and heads to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIGHT is on in the bedroom window.  After a moment it d the house is dark, silhouetted against the horizon by moo BOBBY steps into frame, carrying an iron pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start close on GRACE -- a KEY slapping against her but as bedsprings groan.  We reveal Grace copulating on all f with JAKE from behind. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya little bitch, you like it don't you! You like it this way -- rough and hard. Gotta go fuck around on me, like your Mama, but you always gotta come home to Daddy, don't you, cause you know Daddy's the best. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, hit me...beat me, please. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been a bad girl, Grace. You took my heart from your Mama, didn't ya? You betrayed her! Like you did me. There ain't no forgivin' ya, girl! GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! Oh please forgive me, Papa! JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke her heart! You broke your Mama's heart. You stole me! That's right. Fuck it away. But it ain't ever goin' away, cause your Mama -- she's like a hungry ghost baby, she won't go away, she won't leave ya alone. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! Please! He hits her. Harder. In a strange flashback of his mind, he now sees Grace's M beneath him, receiving his punishment. He stops, abruptly. He can't go on. Fear coming into his He starts to whimper, begging for his punishment and/or forgiveness. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh baby, I'm so sorry... I'm so sorry... (he starts to cry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to hurt you so bad. It just...got away... He drops down, burying his face between Grace's legs. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, baby, forgive me! He hides there from the world that he has created, crying himself. Grace has an unreadable expression, but that's certainly new occurrence in their strange relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knob of the backdoor twists and the door opens.  BOBB quickly through the space and into the house quietly clos door behind him.  It is nearly pitch dark, and he has no bearings.  He steps gingerly through the hall, but in the darkness he bumps into a table nearly knocking over a lam to catch it just before it crashes into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE hears the noise.  He raises his head and cocks an ea the air. She knows who it is, and is concerned; he's too GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't hear something? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I heard a key slapping against my ass. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's someone in the house. GRACE (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe...maybe the wind blew something over (encouraging him to continue). Come on baby, keep going. Jake climbs out of bed, throwing on some pants, reaching drawer in the chest of clothes, pulling out a small dark metallic OBJECT. GRACE (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Jake -- where's you get that? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax baby. Stay here. He goes to the door. She follows, tries to block the door GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, don't go out there. Call the sheriff. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh! Just like your Mama, always scared of things... He maneuvers her aside and slips out the door into the co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowbar in one hand, BOBBY makes his way slowly through t living room, banging against the edge of a table. He hops silently in pain, then waits at the door to the next room listens.  Hearing nothing he slowly pokes his head into t darkness.  A moment later Bobby backs from the door and w the barrel of his own black .9mm BARETTA pressed against forehead.  JAKE appears now, backing him into the living He switches on a LAMP. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well.  As I live and breathe.  I didn't expect to be seeing the like of you again.  Thought you'd be long on your way by now. Jake continues to press the gun to Bobby's head. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my gun...(then) That fucking Darrell! JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Darrell.  He may be an idiot, but he's my half brother. We own Harlin's together, yeah, that little redneck manages to get paid no matter how things work out. BOBBY (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been workin' me the whole time. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess this is what they call "ironee"? Hunh? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what you think, Jake. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it don't matter anyway when you're lying there with your brains all over my carpet and I'm telling Sheriff Potter about this drifter, didn't have enough money to fix his car. And Darrell happened to find his gun, and through maybe this drifter heard old Jake got some money stashed away, and figgered he might try to break in and steal it! BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  Just listen to me... JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And he thought he'd clock old Jake McKenna and turn his brains into wall paper...and then maybe borrow $200 or $20,000, or $200,000... BOBBY (very serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the reason I'm here, Jake. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another reason? It better be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE makes her way down the hall in a nightgown, and now in shadow, listening. BOBBY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came for Grace. JAKE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came to take my wife from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY (sincere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I came to kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE'S eyes get real narrow and angry. JAKE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh! Liar. BOBBY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a thick change of heart from this afternoon. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I don't like being played, like she played us today.  Maybe I don't like that at all, Jake. I'm just pissed enough, maybe I'll rip the neck off my own grandmother. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a lot of talk in you, whole lot of talk. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Jake. There is a guy coming to kill me, and if it comes down to me or Grace, then I pick Grace.  You were going to give me thirteen-thousand.  Give me two-hundred.  I'll kill her and dump the body where no one will ever find it. She showed me the perfect place. There won't be enough left for an autopsy.  But I need the the money.  I've got to have the money. Jake is silent.  He takes his time thinking.  Finally: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE, distressed, starts backing off towards the bedroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY stares at the automatic in JAKE's hand. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna give me my gun? Jake laughs, a "don't even think about it" look. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strangling'll do just fine. Go to work. Bobby holds up his eight fingers with a "you try" look. J shrugs. Bobby points to the crowbar on the carpet. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout the pipe? JAKE (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got a slender neck. Bobby turns and walks towards the bedroom. Jake follows i adjoining room. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second! Come here! Bobby turns to Jake, who is suddenly extremely upset. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell did you know where the bedroom's at? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about! JAKE (getting closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning when I came in on you and Grace, you swore you hadn't been near the bedroom. Now you make straight for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE returns to listen. This thing is like a seesaw batt wills. BOBBY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jake -- JAKE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't Jake me boy! It's a big house. You probably didn't even make it out to the desert this afternoon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE has come right up on BOBBY in a rage. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Or did you just ply the afternoon away between my sheets putting your lips all over her, you little horndog... BOBBY (changing tactics)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What difference does it make if I slept with her? We're gonna kill her. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right! I don't give a damn about her. But killing her's one thing. Fucking her behind my back, that's another! Suddenly Jake swings his arm, clipping Bobby across the s the head with the pistol and opening another bloody gash. Bobby crumbles to his knees, crying out. Jake suddenly grabs Bobby by the hair, forcing his face b smearing his lips with his own in a vengeful kiss. The bl from Bobby's wound runs down to his lips and mixes with J lips. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you've tasted both of us! He pulls back the hammer on the gun and levels it at Bobb head. Bobby sees it coming, plays his last card on his kn BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K.! I admit it! I fucked her! But it's her you have to worry about, not me! She wants you dead, Jake. She wants you dead and she wants your money. JAKE (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you babbling about? BOBBY (talking fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it! How do you think I got in here? Did you hear any glass break? Did you hear a door splinter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE listening. BOBBY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did the evening end?  After you went to bed did she linger a bit?  Maybe just long enough to leave the door unlocked?  Is that what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like an old rag, JAKE gradually soaks all this up becomin heavier with the weight of the knowledge. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd tell me anything to save your pathetic life. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what kind of woman Grace is, Jake. You know how badly she wants to get the fuck out of Superior.  What's she to you, Jake; a woman who wants you dead?  Let me kill her.  All I want is two-hundred dollars to get out of here with. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-hundred dollars? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-hundred dollars...I'll do it!  I'll kill her! A beat. Jake stares down at Bobby on the floor. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Christ, I'd be doing the world a favor, ridding it of the likes of you. Get your miserable ass off the floor. You're positively pathetic... Go on, go kill Grace. Bobby slowly stands. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not letting you walk for nothing. Two hundred dollars. Do it, boy. Kill her. Bobby goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE bolts back to the bedroom, the camera following her flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY walks it. His POV -- the door. Every step seems fre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE is in a quandary. How many seconds before Bobby wal to kill her? Or can he really kill her? She's not sure. She looks around the room frantically. Picks up a lamp, p down. She looks quickly through her closet, rummages belo the boxes. Suddenly she finds it. A dangerous looking Indian HATCHET with a feather hanging its bindings. It's a formidable piece of iron, quite capa splitting a skull or impaling flesh. Grace hears the footsteps just outside the door. She runs the door. A moment later, the bedroom door creaks open and BOBBY qu enters, approaching the bed. We sense the doubt in his ey to whether he can kill her. In a reverse POV, Bobby sees the outline of Grace in the victim...closer, closer.  He now lifts the edge of the be but sees a blanket bunched up to resemble a human figure. He suddenly hears a foot fall behind him, then he feels h presence. He spins. She's directly behind him, hatchet raised. His life is in hands. His eyes, locked in an eternal moment. Her eyes, the hatchet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As JAKE, anxiously torn, waits, there is a LOUD CRASH, fo by SOUNDS of struggle, of murder, of death. Then... GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake! It is a desperate cry for help. Jake can't help himself. breaks into a roaring run down the hall to save his belov JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE bulls into the bedroom. It's a mess, furniture overt sheets and blankets all over the floor. The lights broken Waiting for him, face down on the floor, is BOBBY'S BODY pool of liquid. A broken bottle lies nearby. Bobby's body in its final death throes, and then shudders quiet...  Ov there, by the bed, is GRACE, who still clutches the HATCH The look on her face is pure shock. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...looks like you got him, Grace. That's good...that's real good.  He must of slipped past me, but you got him.  Looks like that drifter from this morning.  Got to be careful who you make friends with, sweetheart. Jake eyes the weapon in Grace's hand. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you put that down? It's all over now.  Put it down. Grace eyes the gun in Jake's hand. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, girl.  Put it down. What choice does Grace have?  She lets the hatchet clank floor. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww, that's my Grace:  Not about to let someone get the best of her.  That's what I love about you.  As dangerous as you are unpredictable. behind Jake, the lifeless BOBBY rises up from the floor, much alive, and clobbers Jake with a golf club. Jake is staggered, but he's one tough old customer as he manages slowly, gun still in one hand, as if to fire. Before he can, Grace grabs up the hatchet from the floor drives it straight into his back. He gurgles, stunned from both sides, but it's like trying kill Rasputin. He still has the gun as Bobby jumps him fr rear, trying to get his neck in a chokehold. The gun FIRE discharging into the wall. The hatchet is ripped from his Grace watches as the two men bang into the walls in a rug rodeo-type fight, Jake seeking to dislodge Bobby off his An expression of fear and excitement in her eyes. Finally the two men go crashing to the ground, rolling ar Bobby maintaining his stranglehold, but calling to her, h hands full. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, goddamit, do something! Jake's eyes rolls up at her like a beaching whale, pleadi help. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace...? She commits. Jumping into the fray, it's not clear whose she's really on as the three of them roll across the floo strangling, biting, hitting, spitting, scratching, gaspin a Guignol, but the pressure from Bobby's forearm is takin toll on Jake. Trying to bite Jake, Grace bites Bobby inst but then she scratches Jake's face. Jake is grabbing her Bobby chokes him, trying to use her to leverage himself a But she manages to rip herself from his grip and scramble her knees across the floor. She grabs the hatchet. And stands, moving back towards th men locked on the floor. Bobby looks up at her, hatchet i no longer sure which way she'll go. Jake, however, gasping for air, eyes bulging, spittle dri from his mouth, looks at Grace with some inner certainty she will help him. He gasps the words. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, Grace, help... GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you helped her, Jake? Grace stands there, deciding, the power of the hatchet in hands. She raises it suddenly over the two men. It flashes downwards. Deep into the gut of her husband Ja almost transfixing him to the floor. In the silence that follows, Jake's eyes roll up to meet But all she has for him is a cold, distant stare. Jake's head drops as the life rushes out of him. Bobby fa back from the body puffing and dripping with sweat. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell'd you wait for? She doesn't answer, turbulence in her face. He rolls Jake off, upset. She may have made it a murder, but he was par it, and he feels the shift in himself. They're both in ne territory, feeling an apartness between them. Suddenly JAKE gasps, still alive! It is too much for Bobb grabs the hatchet and plunges it down on Jake, silencing last time. Grace is pushing the bed away from the wall, slipping dow her knees and prying open several floorboards. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money's right here! Get the key! BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You get it! He doesn't want to get close to Jake. Grace coldly runs o his corpse, ripping the chain, key and all, from the neck action pulls Jake's head up, then she lets it thump back floor. She runs back to the floorboards. The top of a thick steel floor safe is revealed. Bobby watches -- his whole life, it seems, hanging on the outcome. With the key, she opens the safe. Inside are rolled-up bu of cash -- in hundred dollar denominations. She looks up offering it as she reaches in for more. Bobby also gets d his hands and knees and grabs more and more, sucked into fever of freedom, far more money than he lost at the groc store, overcome now with emotions of fear and freedom. They see each other. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I tell you? BOBBY (plunging into the cash)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be 150, 200 thousand here! Goddamnit Grace, you were right! GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We done it, Bobby. Oh my God! They laugh excitedly and start kissing, rolling in the st cash, some of which sticks to Bobby's sweating back. The didn't turn out so bad after all for Bobby. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me baby! BOBBY (looking at Jake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him watch. I want him to know what he's missing. As they consummate their violent relationship for the fir time, Jake's lifeless eyes watch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIGHT in the bedroom window is low candlelight, but w something watching them. GRACE's silhouette moves across window. BOBBY now comes out of the house, cautious, walking down driveway. He stops, thinks, and walks back to open the hood of GRAC He reaches into the ENGINE and disconnects something, the closes the hood and walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY walks up to the SHACK near the garage and bangs on door. A light goes on in the window.  DARRELL shouts out. DARRELL (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you want? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up! DARRELL (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closed.  Come back when the sun comes up. Bobby, in a hurry to get back should Grace pull any trick bangs and kicks against the door. Darrell yanks the door DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell ... oh, it's you.  Might've figgered. Listen I got a waitress coming over.  What do you want? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
