dialogues.text: I want my car. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the money? Bobby pulls the money from his hip pocket and hands it to Darrell.  The mechanic fingers it suspiciously. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-hundred dollars in hundred-dollar bills.  And this morning you was broke. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's none of your business.  Get the keys. DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want no dirty money.  I run an honest business. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like Al Capone on tax day. Get the keys? DARRELL (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's a $50 overnight storage charge we got to talk about. Bobby is ready at first to explode, but then just laughs loud. You got to give it to a guy like Darrell. He holds $100 bill. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I got's a hundred, Darrell. You got change? DARRELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figgers. There's a scratch on the hood and how much you make selling my gun? Deduct it. Bobby pulls the hundred back from Darrell's grasp. DARRELL (going to get the keys)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know nothing about no gun. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course you don't. Tell me something Darrell. Forty thousand people die every day! How come none of them are you? DARRELL (throws him the keys)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you know where to find her. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the trunk key. DARRELL (pulls out the trunk key)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topped off the tank for you. No charge. Just my way of doing business. BOBBY (jovial, confident now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up good, Darrell. I'm getting outta this shithole. You're staying! And one little peep outta you -- remember that gun makes you part of the food chain. Your prints are all over it. I'd be awful careful whose rectum I was pointing my finger in, Darrell. Bobby hops in the car, a free man. As Darrell glares at h bewildered and frightened at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBBY turns the MUSTANG up the drive. THE HEADLIGHTS cut darkness and land on an empty patch where Grace's jeep ha parked.  Bobby jumps from the Mustang and runs around frantically. His look is devastated. He falls to his knee about to sob when: GRACE opens the front door and pokes her head out, puttin several suitcases. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby?  What the hell's the matter with you? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... nothing.  I just stubbed my toe on a rock.  Hurt like hell. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the money all packed.  I put the jeep and his caddy in the garage. People'll think maybe me and Jake went away.  Buy us some time...I know a back road we can take. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking. (looking at her four bags) What's all this? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming back. BOBBY (accepting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright, let's go. I want to be fifty miles from here before the sun comes up. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny thing; the jeep wouldn't start. I had to push it. BOBBY (dryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny thing... I'll get the bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's MUSTANG is backed towards the front of the house. see a silhouette of BOBBY and GRACE carrying something wr in a BLANKET and dumping it in the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone pair of HEADLIGHTS illuminate the night as the Mus cruises through the dark.  As the lights brighten the scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE sits next to BOBBY peering out the windshield, clut the money in a backpack. She's humming an Indian song. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see it. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should be just up ahead.  Hold on ... there!  There it is! A SIGN illuminated by the HEADLIGHTS.  It reads:  YOU ARE LEAVING SUPERIOR.  THANKS FOR VISITING. Grace lets out a scream of joy, leans over and hugs him. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God!  I can't believe it.  I'm out. I'm finally out! The MUSTANG begins to swerve along the road. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Take it easy.  Want to get us killed? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what it feels like to be free of that place. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about that? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spent a day in Superior. I wasted my entire life there. I feel like someone just took a million pounds off my shoulders. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've still got some dead weight to get rid of. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we just dump him fast someplace? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a place where only the vultures will find him...(then) It'll be over soon, Grace. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then will you take me on your friends' boat with you? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sailing his boat. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought -- BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to buy a boat of our own baby, and sail it wherever we want to go. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? Why not? Where should we go? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawaii. I've read all about it. I've dreamed of going there and just lying on the beach while the water licked up against my feet. Oh, God. I'd kill to go there. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already have. She gives him a funny look. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I thought you'd left me back there. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? BOBBY (emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I got back from the garage, and your jeep wasn't there, I thought you'd gone and left me and taken the money. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Cause I never had any luck with women, Grace. You don't know what I been through. The shit I've taken. I thought you were like the rest of 'em... but when you came out of the house... well you're here Grace and we might be starting in the shit but we're starting where I never been -- together with someone -- together with you Grace. She responds with a luminous smile. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you Bobby. He looks back at her with trust and love in his eyes. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna pull this off, Grace. Just then a HEADLIGHT rakes them from the rear as we hear again, the ominous crackle of a POLICE RADIO and the shor brutal "Whoop" of the siren, as Sheriff Potter's VEHICLE up quickly behind them. Grace's face is caught like a sur deer in the headlamps. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stop! Bobby is in a bind. The siren whoops again. The lights fl highbeam. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must've seen us swerving on the road, that's all, just gonna give us a ticket for swerving... But even Bobby has trouble believing that as the POLICE V pulls out sharply alongside his and SHERIFF POTTER motion him aggressively to pull over on the shoulder. SHERIFF (into loudspeaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over, goddamnit, pull over! GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going! She seems to be panicking. Bobby pulls over. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this!...Just shut up, Grace. We done nothing! Be cool. Let me do the talking. He doesn't know anything. His vehicle pulled up on the shoulder in front of them, t Sheriff gets out, shining his power flashlight into their BOBBY (starts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Evening Sheriff, sorry bout that but this jackrabbit... Bobby has no time to react as the Sheriff is suddenly the his window, jerking his door open, angry. A GUN in his ha pointed at them, his eyes on Grace. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to fuck him, didn't you! GRACE (nervous cool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never do that to you, baby... He killed Jake -- said he'd kill me if I didn't come with him. All he wants is the money. Bobby looks at her. He cannot believe what he just heard. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! SHERIFF (flipping, yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me! Grace knows the jam is up. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK...but he never made me cum! Really Virgil, I was only doing what I had to do so we could be free. Just like we talked about. It meant nothing. A pause. Virgil wants to kill her, but he also wants her badly. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking him too Grace? Is everybody fucking everybody in this town? She ignores him. Her attention on the backpack with the m between her legs -- the gun is there, inside an outer fla the bag. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuck this guy -- get him to do your dirty work and you think you can take the money and dump me? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No baby, you got it wrong. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This road don't go to Globe, Grace -- where were you going to meet me? His flashlight on the four suitcases in the backseat. She doesn't have an answer to that one. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like that it... Look, Virgil, I got the money here. She gets out of the car on her side, comes around to him, pack of money slung on her shoulder, hard to see in the d SHERIFF (hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Grace, you can say what you want...but, I watched you fuck that pervert for years while you're telling me you loved me? What happened to going to Milwaukee together? You and me -- gonna open up the finest sporting goods store that city ever did see? Get us a place on the north shore, by the lake? Season Brewer tickets! Just you and me, Grace. What happened? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All talk, that's all you did was talk, and all I did was sit around getting older waiting for you to free me! You never did nothin' Virgil, you're weak! (pointing to Bobby) He did! The Sheriff, deeply wounded, casts a hot vicious gaze on SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is some girl you and me got here Bobby, yessir, an excellent cocksuck too, wouldn't you say? (back at Grace)... Course you had a lotta practice haven't you darling, going way back to your crazy mama! GRACE (deadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Virgil! Take your share of the money. It's not so bad. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want the fuckin' money! I'm not gonna give up everything I got for a lousy 50,000 dollars. It's you. You Grace or nothing. The whole thing... I want you to be my wife...(hopeful). What do you way Grace? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound just like Jake... I did see into the future, Virgil, but you weren't in it. Go back to your family. They love you. Bobby gets out of the car, misunderstanding the situation BOBBY (misunderstanding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we got more. We got $200,000 at least. Split it three ways, we all walk away... The Sheriff snaps and smashes Bobby with his flashlight, knocking him to the ground, kicking him again and again, gathering the psychic force to murder him. Grace tries to approach. SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, boy! You don't know shit round here! (to Grace) Get back. Did she tell you that story about the bird flying away? BOBBY (rolling on the ground)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Look, I ... ow! GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop it! SHERIFF (kicking again and again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you going to help her fly away, asshole? What'd you think, you were the first boy to drift through this town she came on to? She tell you the story about old Jake forcing her to marry him? That's a good story... How he killed her crazy Mama? Bobby in bloody agony. Grace stunned that Virgil would re this now publicly. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit Virgil, stop!  Don't! SHERIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But I bet the story she didn't tell you was the best story of all. How old crazy Jake was really her Papa. And she liked fucking Papa! And now she's killed the sonufabitch! Just like she's gonna kill you! Grace plunges into the pack, pulls the gun and shoots Vir across the car in the gut. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...you! You! The Sheriff flies back onto the road, stunned, not realiz what's happened. Bobby watches unbelieving as Grace quietly steps up over Sheriff. She puts the next round in his nuts, a modern fury enacti ancient wrath. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace. No! The Sheriff is wide-eyed, dying in shock. Grace then fire at his head in a coup de grace that blows his brains out back of his head. Grace and Bobby both stare, then Grace jumps into action, dragging the body. She snaps to Bobby. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me get him off the road. Into the car! We'll ditch his car... Get the fuck up! Bobby stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're driving. GRACE and BOBBY, wordless, each thinking separate worlds. Grace wipes her hands. The bag with the between her legs. The Baretta is back in the bag. BOBBY (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, did you have to kill him? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get real Bobby. He was gonna kill you and me. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in love with you Grace. He would've done what you wanted, you could've made a deal and ... GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only deal he had in mind was killing you for Jake's murder and blackmailing me into sucking his dick for the rest of my life... no thanks. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a cop, Grace, they never stop looking for you when you kill a cop... GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a scumbag!... He wanted me, Bobby. These guys don't let go! Even when they're dead... (softer) You don't know what it was like, Bobby. Those two, they were the same. A silence. The oncoming road. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, aren't you going to ask me? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask you what? You mean what kind of horrifying sick shit is coming next? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to know...? I bet it's burning a hole in your brain just now? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go, baby. It's the past. I got a past... GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you really want to know? Was Jake my Daddy? Was I fucking my own Daddy? Don't you want to know that? BOBBY (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say! She's yelling, emotionally out of control. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! I was! I was fucking Daddy! And I married him!... I married him...okay? She looks at Bobby, forces him to look at her. Finally: BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why! She drops back in her seat. Tears come. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I wanted was to be a kid... He took that from me... They all did... (very quietly, dangerously) They treated me like meat. A piece of meat. Fuck me. Blow me. Bend over. Stick their fingers up my ass... Fuck them! Fuck the whole town! They deserved to die! A pause. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And us Grace? What do we deserve? GRACE (crying quietly to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Nin chonk, nin chonk," my Mama used to say in Apache. "Your worst is doing this to you," she said, "your worst has killed you." And "Be go tsee" -- "you will find out the result of what you have done..." Just when you think it's over, when you've gotten away, it begins. Cause you never get away. Bobby stares straight ahead at the oncoming road. Can he love her? She seems to be reading his thoughts, like she she could. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy to judge someone else when you don't know nothing about it... I'm Apache, Bobby. You don't eat what I eat. You don't see what I see. Don't judge me. A silence. Two former lovers in the dark of a car moving the strangeness of an Arizona desert at night. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to think anymore. GRACE (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then drive... The lights of the car fade until there is nothing but dar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the vast reaches of a deserted canyon, where VULTURES in a hot white sky, we find the MUSTANG parked at the edg drop. We hear the SOUND of a body being dragged. D.J. (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nobody's sure where it was heading so fast but the way it hit the semi, it won't be getting home now! Hey area weather is gonna be hot! Hot! Hot! Then cold! Cold! Cold! Just like yesterday. Just like every day. Some surprise, huh? So if you're planning on anything, don't. You don't like the weather, just wait one minute. Got any brains, get up to Alaska and get yourself some trailer park where you don't see no desert for miles and miles... BOBBY (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there... Drop it there. I got it. BOBBY is giving GRACE instructions as they drop SHERIFF V POTTER'S corpse over a drop onto some rocks 30 yards belo GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya, Virgil. God bless. Bobby pushes him over, his hand hurting. The body crashes It's hard work. They head back for the Mustang, to retrie JAKE'S body in the popped trunk. But Grace notices Bobby glancing at the Baretta now tucked in her waist. The silence is tense between them, the rocks and gravel crunching under their shoes as they walk. GRACE (indicates the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what's bothering you Bobby? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Grace, my hand's bothering me. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think now that Jake's dead, there's all that money there and I don't need you anymore, and I might just sneak up behind you sometime and...pop! She pulls an imaginary trigger on Bobby, mimicking the re a gun. Bobby is nervous. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I would've done it if I wanted to? What can I do to make you relax, baby? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could give me my gun back. Grace smiles. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just finish what we started. She stares down at Jake. She can't help feeling some old feelings. As Bobby walks back to the front of the car, tu the annoying radio. He watches as she softly prays over J whose face is concealed by the blanket in which he is rol GRACE (after a moment with Jake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think happens to someone's spirit when they die? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think nothing happens. You're dead meat. That's it. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe in anything do you, Bobby? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe in this moment, that's all. There is nothing else. (lifting Jake by the shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. He must weigh 300 pounds. Grace leans into the trunk to take his boots when he make move, quickly, closing on her when she's off guard. He sl hard in the face, coldly sending her sprawling to the gro dazed. He steps over her and grabs the gun in her waist, checks She puts her hand to her mouth, feels the blood on her fi tips. She looks at him and laughs a wild crazed laugh tha into Bobby like a knife. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hit me, Bobby? You hit a woman, you motherfucker! Didn't your Momma ever teach you anything...? Her eyes go to the gun in his hand and she stops laughing calm is extraordinary, as if expecting to die. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? For a moment, Bobby does nothing, then he slips the gun t his belt. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, nothing. We dump Jake, we split the money, then you're on your own. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me. I want to say with you, Bobby. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? So when the cops catch up with us you can sell me out again? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just baiting him! Bobby, I had to tell him that to get his guard down. Just like you told Jake you was going to kill me! BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me all along! Lies, all lies. Your mother, your father, what story are you on now?  How come the town didn't know you was his daughter? GRACE (in pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause my Mom slept around. A lotta men! Anybody could've been my father. But we knew. BOBBY (not listening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you got what you wanted all along by fucking me.  I wish you had told me the goddamn truth in the first place! GRACE (screws out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want you to know! Don't you... unnerstand? Bobby's got a headache now. It's too much to understand, much talk. Too much history has taught him to doubt. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're finished with me, I'm next! I been there, baby. I been there with other cunts...sorry, not anymore. I'll take you as far as California. If we can make that. After that you're on your own. Try Mexico. With all this bread, you can live like a queen. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go to Mexico, Bobby! Please, I really want to be with you. Don't blow this. Don't you think I care about you? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're a lying, back-stabbing psycho bitch, and one day you'll kill me. But it's nice to know you cared... The expression on Grace's face changes as rapidly as the weather, a coldness passing over and through her. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know your own mind. It blocks your heart. Keeping a wary eye on Grace, Bobby starts hauling Jake ou the trunk. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a hand. He wrestles Jake up to a sitting position. He grabs a can beer from a warm six-pack in the trunk and shoves it into pocket of Jake's coat. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor old Jake, a few drinks, a fight with the sheriff over his wife. And both of 'em ended up dead. Grace takes his boots. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go for a walk, Jake. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother died in this canyon. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save the Mom routine, will ya Grace. It doesn't work with me. One, two, three... They lift the corpse, and with great effort, haul it towa edge of the drop. As they pause on the way, Bobby, wary o Grace's strange coldness, tries to soften the blow of separation. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's not so bad we split up. It might be months before they find these guys. If at all. I mean with the mountain lions around here. Remember, if they can't find no bodies, there's no crime... (She doesn't respond.) We'll be in Phoenix by noon. Lose this car, get another one. Texas, Mexico are big countries, all that money Grace, you'll meet someone else, you know, there's a lot of hope with a $100,000... They lift Jake again, and move to the edge. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope is a four-letter word. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we all need that too. Hold him. He props Jake at the edge, standing, and transfers the we onto Grace. Jake's head is on her shoulder. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make a pretty couple. It seems he might push them both over but instead takes t wipes it of his prints, and slips it through Jake's belt. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won this in a poker game in Reno. God knows who it's registered to.  You shoulda been more careful, Jake. See you later. As he takes Jake's weight off Grace and pushes it over th Grace watches him go, her eyes shifting to Bobby, his bac momentarily to her, also watching. She moves towards him. Bobby turns, slips on the edge. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now all we got to do is try and-- He feels a blur of motion, almost like a bird, and he is falling...falling, his life coming to an end. Grace is standing somewhere up above, briefly seen. Did s him? He doesn't know. He's stunned as he falls on the rocks next to the bodies and Virgil. He screams out in sharp pain. His leg feels b But he is alive. Grace walks away, cutting it all off, deeply shaken. She get away from the past and all these hollow men. She clos trunk of the Mustang, gets in the driver's seat, reaches ignition key. Her hand fumbles for it a moment. It isn't GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! She sits there. Bobby is calling from below. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace! Help me, Grace...! We been through too much together.  We've only had one day, but you and me have been through more than most people ever will. I know you were angry at me, and, you know, you were right! I'm sorry I hit you. I was wrong about leaving you. You don't belong in Mexico. She finally gets out and walks back to the edge of the cl looks down. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you. I...I knew you wouldn't leave me, Grace. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby? Are you all right? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I busted my leg! GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you make it back up? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace -- in the trunk of my car is a tow rope. It should reach down here. Go get it, throw it down. She looks. Of course the trunk is closed. She closed it. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, the trunk...it's locked. Throw the keys up to me. I'll get the rope. Bobby's eyes pass over Jake a few feet away, his eyes sta upwards in death. They take in the gun still attached to waist. He knows the trunk wasn't locked when they took Ja BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't throw that far. You got to climb down here and get the keys. You can make it. It's the only way Grace. Grace looks down at the drop.  It's a tough descent but s knows she could make it and get back up as well. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace!...Please, Grace!  You have to help me. Grace takes a look around. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm coming. Calm down! She starts down the cliff face. As she descends, he talks deliriously. BOBBY (off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd help me. I knew you wouldn't leave me baby, cause we're tied together too close. We belong together always. Grace makes it to the bottom of the drop, and walks cauti towards Bobby. GRACE (yelling back, echoing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby! Don't flip out on me. I can't do this alone. I know you don't trust me, but you gotta pull yourself together, I'm not gonna leave you...I never wanted it to go down like this. It was different with you Bobby. You had dreams like me. You listened... I would've gone anywhere with you, Bobby. We can make this work. I'm sorry...I really am. I didn't wanna hurt you. Can he believe her? She sounds so sincere this time. She's heading for the body of Jake. And the gun. Bobby kn that and is already crawling there. BOBBY (as he crawls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're right here, Grace.  The keys.  Come get me out of here... Know why else I could never leave you? GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that? BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I love you. Inching closer. Closer. They meet at the apex of Jake's corpse. GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I love you too. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And love's a funny thing.  Sometimes I don't know if I want to love you... Grace leans close to Bobby.  He dangles the keys out in f her, but she doesn't reach for them. Her eyes go to Bobby reaches for him. At that instant Bobby's hands shoot out clamp hard around her.  A sharp gurgle is all that escape as Bobby twists the life from her, as Jake leers up at th BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...or kill you. Grace twists and flails in Bobby's hands, but in spite of bleeding stump, he holds her like a bear trap holds a gri BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you Grace, but I just can't trust you! She looks at him, trying to protest, shaking her head. Gr flailing goes into overdrive. Somewhere in his semi-delir state, Bobby's eyes might notice the gun at Jake's waist longer there. Grace manages one word: GRACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake... BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't help you now, honey! Bobby is in agony as he kills her, part beast, part lover kills that which he loves. Suddenly, a SHOT is heard. Bobby buckles with the blast, the side. He kills her with one last wrenching thrust of hands, breaking her neck. Bobby looks down at Jake's gun, which she clutches in her and sees the hole in his side and the river of blood that from it.  He manages to stand, looks at Jake; their bodie side by side. Bobby, with great difficulty, claws his way back up the r the car, his fast-flowing wound staining the white rocks blood. He makes it to the top and, losing more blood, climbs int driver's seat. He checks the money in the bag. All there. his. As he pulls a huge clot of blood from his side, the vultu circle. Perhaps one, smarter than the others, lands close spooks Bobby but he's okay. He looks in the mirror. BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still lucky. He puts the key in the ignition, the engine comes to life BOBBY (waves back)

dialogues.text: Adios -- Suddenly, the RADIATOR HOSE Darrell installed blows apart loudly. Bobby knows exactly and immediately what it is as cloud of steam now rolls from under his hood. He shakes h head, frustrated. BOBBY (sighs)
